value.description:
A large, distinctive-looking tree with a unique life-cycle, warm, skin-smooth bark and long iridescent leaves. Infused with bioluminescent micro-organisms, anima trees develop a unique form of psychic symbiosis with surrounding lifeforms. Each Ancient Anima tree contains a small non-conscious dryad queen. The queen births creatures called dryads which guard and tend the tree. In exchange, the tree nurtures its protectors by feeding them directly. From the outside, it appears the dryads are created by the tree directly and act as part of it.

It is possible for a person to form a connection with a tree and partially control the dryads it produces.

Some say Ancient Anima trees are the homes of nature spirits that follow humanity across worlds. Tribal psycasters are also able to draw psyfocus from anima trees while meditating to them.

Anima trees' psychic properties are weakened if artificial structures are placed nearby. They refuse to be caged or studied, and must remain part of nature.
Symbiotic bush infused with luminous microorganisms, often found growing around Ancient Anima trees.
A small pod that protects a single Anima seed. This seed can be harvested and used to plant an Ancient Anima tree.
The seed of an Ancient Anima tree. It can be planted to create a new Ancient Anima tree.

Dryads are small mammalian creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Ancient Anima trees. This immature dryad can support and protect its tree, but its main purpose is to morph into more specialized and powerful dryad forms.

A slow, bumbling caste of dryad which specializes in wood production. Together with its Ancient Anima tree, this dryad can generate a wood-like material on an ongoing basis. However, it is slow and ineffective at work or combat.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Ancient Anima trees. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

A dryad caste specialized in food production. Together with its Ancient Anima tree, this dryad can generate nourishing berries on an ongoing basis. However, it is slow and ineffective at work or combat.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Ancient Anima trees. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

A dryad caste with the unique ability to produce new Anima seed pods and reproduce the Ancient Anima tree along with its symbiote, the dryad queen. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

A dryad caste specialized in carrying items. Under human influence, it can help haul things where they need to go.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Ancient Anima trees. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

Though it can do tremendous damage, it is vulnerable to attacks itself.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Ancient Anima trees. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

The anima tree now has {0} anima grass around it. This is enough for a tribal person to begin their first linking ritual!

The linking ritual gives a level of psylink and the ability to use psychic powers. Upgrading to a higher level requires more grass at each level.

The anima grass requirements for linking rituals to upgrade psycasters are:

{1}

Note: Only those with the nature focus type can meditate to or link with anima trees. You can see a person's focus types by looking at their info card with the 'i' button.
